page.title: 03BURWASH C.E. SCHOOL
page.content: The village school is typical of the "chapel-type" of construction of the 19th century and is situated just off the High Street. There are 150 children and 6 teachers including the Headmaster. The children, aged between four and a half years and eleven years old start lessons at 9.00am. and finish at 3.30.pm. Considerable changes in education over the past few years have altered methods of teaching drastically - not least, the advent of the micro-computer (in every school since 1984) which has made such an enormous task as the Domesday Project a possibility.
